<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Parameters (see the expansion example below):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (the builder, %addr, %loaded, %new&#95;val, ordering,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  /&#42; OUT &#42;/ %success, /&#42; OUT &#42;/ %new&#95;loaded,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// %MetadataSrc)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase">IRBuilderBase</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7">AtomicOrdering</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/syncscope/#a80741d3f96133391b683effd8e5b77f0">SyncScope::ID</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;&amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;&amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;)&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Expand an atomic RMW instruction into a loop utilizing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cmpxchg. You&#39;ll want to make sure your target machine likes cmpxchg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions in the first place and that there isn&#39;t another, better,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// transformation available (for example AArch32/AArch64 have linked loads).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is useful in passes which can&#39;t rewrite the more exotic RMW</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions directly into a platform specific intrinsics (because, say,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// those intrinsics don&#39;t exist). If such a pass is able to expand cmpxchg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions directly however, then, with this function, it could avoid two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// extra module passes (avoiding passes by &#96;-atomic-expand&#96; and itself). A</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// specific example would be PNaCl&#39;s &#96;RewriteAtomics&#96; pass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Given: atomicrmw some&#95;op iN&#42; %addr, iN %incr ordering</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The standard expansion we produce is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     &#91;...&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     %init&#95;loaded = load atomic iN&#42; %addr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     br label %loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loop:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     %loaded = phi iN &#91; %init&#95;loaded, %entry &#93;, &#91; %new&#95;loaded, %loop &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     %new = some&#95;op iN %loaded, %incr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ; This is what -atomic-expand will produce using this function on i686</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// targets:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     %pair = cmpxchg iN&#42; %addr, iN %loaded, iN %new&#95;val</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     %new&#95;loaded = extractvalue &#123; iN, i1 &#125; %pair, 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     %success = extractvalue &#123; iN, i1 &#125; %pair, 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ; End callback produced IR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     br i1 %success, label %atomicrmw.end, label %loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// atomicrmw.end:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     &#91;...&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns true if the containing function was modified.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa59c4ae8c95bb222039942e9ba995c3e">expandAtomicRMWToCmpXchg</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomicrmwinst">AtomicRMWInst</a> &#42;AI, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8dde02199294f1d66e0f5979b8be3180">CreateCmpXchgInstFun</a> CreateCmpXchg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace llvm</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;ATOMICEXPANDUTILS&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
